title.title: Shepherd's Bush (Hammersmith and City) station closures

texts: Refurbishment works to improve Shepherd's Bush (Hammersmith & City line) station as part of Transport for London's (TfL) five-year £10bn investment programme are presently underway.
Customers are advised to use Goldhawk Road station or Shepherd's Bush (Central line) station
While this refurbishment work takes place, Shepherd's Bush station will close at 2100 on various evenings from November 6 2005 until February 2006.
When Queens Park Rangers are playing at home, the closure will commence at 2300.
The station will also be closed on the weekends of:
During these closures, Hammersmith & City line trains will not stop at the station.
Customers are advised to use Goldhawk Road station or Shepherd's Bush (Central line) station instead.
Journeys will be increased by up to 20 minutes.

The refurbishment works to be undertaken by Metronet Rail SSL will include the replacement of CCTV cameras, installation of customer Help Points, an enhanced public address system, new wall tiles, improved lighting and ceilings and tactile strips on platforms and stairs, along with contrasting handrails.
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Transport for London is investing £10bn over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, more than half of that in the Tube","Metronet Rail SSL is responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Circle, District, Hammersmith \u0026 City, Metropolitan and East London lines"]}
